text: What do you think "free weights" means in a gym context?

answers.text: Dumbbells and barbells you can move around freely
Equipment that doesn"t cost extra to use
I think I know but not 100% sure
Weights not attached to machines - I use them regularly
The complimentary snacks at the gym juice bar

text: What do you think is most important for weight loss?

answers.text: Eating less calories than you burn
Cutting out all carbs completely
Lots of cardio exercise
I honestly don"t know where to start
Hiring a personal chef and moving to a yoga retreat

text: If someone said "I'm doing 3 sets of 10 reps," what would you think they mean?

answers.text: Three groups of ten repetitions of an exercise
That sounds familiar but I couldn"t explain it
No idea - is that a workout thing?
Standard exercise format - I program my own workouts
They"re really into sales - 3 sets of 10 customer reps

text: Your friend invites you to a spin class tomorrow morning. Your first thought is:

answers.text: Sure! I love trying new workout classes
I'd go but I have no idea what to expect
Maybe, but I'll probably bail last minute like usual
Can"t - too many work/family commitments
Is that the class where we make pottery?

text: Which of these sounds most like your ideal Saturday morning?

answers.text: Sleeping in - I need my weekend recovery
Kids' activities and errands - family comes first
Checking my fitness tracker stats from the week
Meeting friends for a workout or active brunch
Training my pet hamster to run a tiny obstacle course

text: You see someone doing squats at the gym. What goes through your mind?

answers.text: I check their form and depth - always learning
I wonder if they'd help me learn that exercise
That looks hard - I'd hurt myself trying that
I should be doing those but never feel confident enough
Why are they sitting down and standing up repeatedly?

text: Your doctor says you should 'get more exercise.' Your honest reaction is:

answers.text: I know, I know - but where do I even start?
Already on it - just need to be more consistent
Time to track everything and optimize my health metrics
Great, another thing to squeeze into my packed schedule
Does vigorously clicking the TV remote count?

text: When you hear 'muscle soreness,' you think:

answers.text: DOMS - usually peaks 24-48 hours after exercise
That feeling after I tried working out that one time
The reason I stopped my last workout program
Good pain that means I'm making progress
What happens when you sleep on your TV remote

text: If you had 20 free minutes right now, you would most likely:

answers.text: Knock out a quick workout - every minute counts
Research the perfect workout plan (again)
Rest - I'm already exhausted from everything else
Text a friend to see if they want to walk
Finally organize my collection of unused gym membership cards

text: What would make you most likely to stick with an exercise program?

answers.text: Seeing measurable improvements in my numbers
Having a workout buddy or group to meet
Quick workouts that fit my crazy schedule
Understanding why each exercise matters
If Netflix added a 'burn calories to unlock next episode' feature
